metadata.description:
This data folder “LS4P-I” includes the model products from the GEWEX/Impact of initialized Land Surface temperature and Snowpack on Sub-seasonal to Seasonal Prediction (GEWEX/LS4P) project.  The LS4P was launched in the 2018 GEWEX Science Conference, Alberta, Canada.  More than 40 institutions which include many major weather and climate prediction centers, from 5 continents have participated in this effort.  The LS4P Phase I (LS4P-I) experiment focused on whether the Tibetan Plateau land surface temperature and subsurface temperature (TP LST/SUBT) provides an additional source for subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) predictability.
The results of simulations with the coupled model BESM version 2.8 following the protocols of the LS4P-I experiment.

background: Subseasonal to seasonal (S2S) prediction of droughts and floods is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction. Recent studies suggest that the springtime land surface temperature/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) over the Tibetan Plateau (TP) can be a new source of S2S predictability. The successful prediction of droughts and floods at subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) time scales is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction, with failures that can result in major adverse impacts on societies and economies. Sea surface temperature (SST) variations such as those associated with the Madden-Julian Oscillations are known to provide a predictability source. Recent studies suggest that springtime land surface/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) provides a new source of predictability at S2S time scales. The Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program has initiated the project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” to investigate the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions.

The background temperature gradient at midlatitudes also affects the activity of baroclinic eddies (Xue et al., 2023), which can further reinforce the zonal wind changes and further influence the zonal wind downstream as the eddies move downstream and interact with the zonal flow. The response of the zonal wind in the downstream of TP is consistent with these studies, exhibiting a significant deceleration of the zonal wind along the jet core over the North Pacific. Meanwhile, a significant acceleration of the zonal wind is found to the north of the jet core, indicating a slight northward shift of the jet stream. Such changes in the zonal wind have their counterparts in the observations (see Fig. 4b). One salient feature in Fig. 5a is the strong negative geopotential height anomaly over the TP at 200 hPa, accompanied with a cyclonic anomalous circulation. Such a circulation response corresponds to the cold anomaly over the TP, where the atmosphere sinks and induces negative potential height anomalies at upper levels. Furthermore, evident wave-like patterns downstream from the TP to the North Pacific are shown in the geopotential height difference in Fig. 5a. The negative center of geopotential height anomaly over the TP extends eastward to Japan, while a strong positive geopotential height center with anticyclonic circulation flow emerges to the east over the Bering Strait with a center around 170°E, 50°N. The wave-like geopotential height differences further extend from the Rocky Mountain across the North American continent, North Atlantic Ocean, and back to the Eurasian continent. The above simulated response in atmospheric circulations is in general consistent with the observed geopotential height anomalies in May 2003 (Fig. 5b). In addition, responses in the geopotential height to the cold TP surface are also noticed in the Southern Hemisphere, especially in the midlatitudes (Fig. 5a, b). Therefore, we also inspect the anomalous stream function from the simulated wind. The WAF is parallel to the group velocity of Rossby waves and can approximately indicate the wave energy propagation.

Although the teleconnections caused by the heating due to oceanic temperature anomalies, such as those between ENSO and the Asian monsoons, have been extensively investigated (e.g., Wang et al. 2000; Li et al. 2007; Li et al. 2017), the remote effects of mountain heating on global atmospheric circulations have not been fully studied. The LS4P-I experiment provides a chance to explore the detailed features of the TRC wave train as well as the global response of atmospheric circulations to the TP surface anomaly. It is well known and extensively studied that the TP surface thermal state can significantly influence the weather and climate in East Asia (e.g. Liu et al. 2020). Earlier studies have shown that, in summertime, there exists a circumglobal teleconnection pattern (CTP) in the extra-tropics of the Northern Hemisphere along the westerly jet. The latent heat with the strong convective monsoon precipitation is suggested a major driver for the CTP (e.g. Lau and Peng 1991; Lau and Weng 2002; Lau et al. 2004 ; Ding and Wang 2005; Ding et al. 2011).
research objective: The project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” was initiated to study the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions. The present work explores the simulated global scale response of the atmospheric circulation to the springtime TP land surface cooling by 16 current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) participating in the LS4P Phase I (LS4P-I) experiment. More dynamical understanding of the TRC wave train as well as its cross-equator propagation into the Southern Hemisphere will be explored in the newly launched LS4P phase II experiment.

This study has investigated the mechanisms of the global atmospheric response to the TP spring LST/SUBT anomalies in simulations by LS4P-I ESMs. To further explore the TP’s role and the influence of TRC wave train in S2S predictions, we check the response simulated by each model in May. These results taken together suggest that the TRC wave train plays a key role in the influence of TP’s surface and subsurface temperatures on the hot spot regions, especially for the regions in North America, though the detailed mechanisms through which the TRC wave train affects the precipitation in these different regions still need further investigations.
Our aim is to place the TP LST/SUBT’s influence on the global atmospheric circulations with a focus on the dynamical feature of the TRC wave train and its importance for improving S2S prediction.

However, there are phase differences between the simulated wave train and the observations. However, over the regions from the North Atlantic to the Ural Mountains, the observed geopotential height anomalies show opposite signs to the multi-model average, suggesting that in those regions the TP surface cooling may not be the major cause for the observed circulation anomalies. The main difference is that the simulated atmospheric response in model ensemble evolve faster than the observation. The associated diversities in the model response in the Southern Hemispheric circulations could be one of the main reasons that the simulated response exhibit great inconsistency with the observation, though the model ensembles show strong Southern Hemispheric responses especially in the mid-high latitudes.

Compared with the observation, none of the LS4P-I ESMs well captures the observed T2m cold anomaly in May 2003. The ensemble mean of the 16 LS4P-I ESMs exhibits a warm bias of 1.02 °C over the TP, which is stronger than the standard deviation of the observed inter-annual variation of TP T2m (about 0.7 °C). The spatial distribution of the model bias for the ensemble mean is shown in Fig. 1b, which shows a clear warm bias in May 2003 T2m over the eastern part of the TP. The LS4P-I simulations further show that the TP surface thermal state not only has circumglobal influence in the Northern Hemisphere, but it also affects the extratropical atmospheric circulation in the Southern Hemisphere, though with a large uncertainty due to inter-model variability.
methods: In the first phase of the LS4P project (LS4P-I), the year 2003 is the focal case, in which extreme summer drought/flood occurred in East Asia after a very cold spring in the TP. Two sets of numerical experiments were conducted in LS4P-I to investigate the global influence of the TP spring surface temperature anomaly. A first set of runs, referred to as EXP_CTRL, is designed to evaluate the performance of the 16 ESMs in simulating the TP T2m and precipitation anomalies during May and June 2003. In EXP_CTRL runs, the ESMs start simulations from late April or May 1st, and use the standard S2S prediction setting of atmospheric and land initial conditions. Another set of numerical experiments was carried out by the ESMs to test whether the regional bias in June precipitation mentioned in the previous paragraph is related to the bias in May surface temperature over TP. In this set of experiments, which are collectively referred to as EXP_LST/SUBT run, the models’ bias in May TP T2m is reduced by initializing the TP LST and SUBT conditions.
dataset: The ensemble mean of simulated 200 hPa geopotential height difference is also illustrated in Fig. 5a together with the observations for May 2003 (Fig. 5b), to further explore the atmospheric circulation responses to the TP LST/SUBT effect.

The observed T2m anomaly in the TP is shown in Fig. 1a, for which we use the data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS, Fan and van den Dool 2008). We use the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5, Hersbach et al. 2020), which is referred to as observations, with a regular horizontal resolution of 1.0° × 1.0° to investigate the atmospheric circulation in year 2003 and for climatology, with the latter defined as the average from year 1981 to 2015. All data are provided at 0.5° × 0.5° spatial resolution. The global precipitation data are from the Climate Research Unit (CRU), in which version 4.02 is used when implementing the analysis (Harris et al. 2014; 2020).
findings: The LS4P-I results show, for the first time, that springtime TP surface anomalies can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal (TRC) wave train from the TP via the northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the western part of the North America, along with the springtime westerly jet from TP across the whole North Pacific basin. The TRC wave train modulated by the TP thermal anomaly play a critical role on the early summer surface air temperature and precipitation anomalies in the regions along the wave train, especially over the northwest North America and the southern Great Plains. These results suggest that the TP LST/SUBT anomaly via the TRC wave train is the first order source of the S2S variability in the regions mentioned.

These results taking together suggest that the TRC wave train plays a key role in the influence of TP’s surface and subsurface temperatures on the hot spot regions, especially for the regions in North America, though the detailed mechanisms through which the TRC wave train affects the precipitation in these different regions still need further investigations. The ensemble model simulations show that, with the strong westerly jet across the extratropical Asian-Pacific region, the TP surface cooling generates a barotropic, persistent (evolving in time scales longer than a month) TRC wave train from TP through northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the west part of the North America, whose features closely resemble the observed geopotential height anomaly from May to June in 2003.

The key features of the simulated ensemble mean of June precipitation in response to the TP LST/SUBT effect were discussed in Xue et al. (2022). The LS4P-I experiment, however, shows that the TP surface anomaly can result in persistent and global scale anomalies in atmospheric circulations, and has a near-global influence on the summer T2m and precipitation on S2S time scale. Furthermore, the LS4P-I experiment confirms and highlights the important even critical role of the TRC wave train in the global influence of the TP surface anomaly. The analysis of 16 state-of-the-art ESMs shows for the first time that the springtime TP surface anomaly can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic TRC wave train.
backgroundCn: 亚季节到季节（S2S）预测干旱和洪水是天气和气候预测中的一个主要挑战。最近的研究表明，春季青藏高原（TP）的地表温度/地下温度（LST/SUBT）可以成为S2S预测的新来源。成功预测亚季节到季节（S2S）时间尺度上的干旱和洪水是天气和气候预测中的一个重大挑战，失败可能导致对社会和经济产生重大不利影响。海表温度（SST）变化，例如与麦登-朱利安振荡相关的变化，已知提供了一个可预测性来源。最近的研究表明，春季地表/地下温度（LST/SUBT）在S2S时间尺度上提供了一个新的可预测性来源。全球能源与水循环交换（GEWEX）计划已启动“初始化地表温度和雪盖对亚季节到季节预测影响（LS4P）”项目，以研究春季LST/SUBT异常对夏季降水预测的影响。

中纬度的背景温度梯度也影响了斜压涡旋的活动（Xue et al., 2023），这进一步增强了纬向风的变化，并在涡旋向下游移动并与纬向流相互作用时进一步影响下游的纬向风。青藏 Plateau（TP）下游的纬向风响应与这些研究一致，表现为北太平洋喷流核心沿线的纬向风显著减速。同时，在喷流核心北侧发现纬向风显著加速，表明喷流略微向北偏移。这种纬向风的变化在观测中也有对应（见图4b）。图5a中的一个显著特征是TP上方200 hPa的强负位势高度异常，伴随着气旋异常环流。这种环流响应对应于TP上的冷异常，导致大气下沉并在上层诱发负位势高度异常。此外，图5a中显示了从TP向北太平洋下游明显的波状模式的位势高度差。TP上方的负位势高度异常中心向东延伸至日本，而在白令海峡东侧出现了一个强正位势高度中心，伴随反气旋环流，中心位于约170°E，50°N。波状的位势高度差进一步从落基山脉延伸穿过北美大陆、北大西洋，回到欧亚大陆。上述模拟的气候环流响应总体上与2003年5月的观测位势高度异常一致（图5b）。此外，在南半球，尤其是在中纬度地区，也注意到对冷TP表面的位势高度响应（图5a，b）。因此，我们还检查了模拟风场的异常流函数。波动能量通量（WAF）与罗斯贝波的群速度平行，能够大致指示波能量的传播。

尽管由于海洋温度异常引起的热带遥相关（如ENSO与亚洲季风之间的关系）已被广泛研究（例如，Wang等，2000；Li等，2007；Li等，2017），但山地加热对全球大气环流的远程影响尚未得到充分研究。LS4P-I实验提供了一个机会，以探讨热带高原（TP）表面异常的详细特征以及大气环流对其的全球响应。众所周知，TP表面的热状态可以显著影响东亚的天气和气候（例如，Liu等，2020）。早期研究表明，在夏季，北半球的副热带地区沿着西风急流存在一种环全球遥相关模式（CTP）。强对流季风降水中的潜热被认为是CTP的主要驱动因素（例如，Lau和Peng 1991；Lau和Weng 2002；Lau等，2004；Ding和Wang 2005；Ding等，2011）。
research objectiveCn: 项目“初始化地表温度和雪盖对季节内到季节预测的影响（LS4P）”旨在研究春季地表温度/雪盖异常对高山地区夏季降水预测的影响。目前的工作探讨了16个参与LS4P第一阶段（LS4P-I）实验的当前先进地球系统模型（ESMs）对春季天山地区地表冷却的全球尺度大气环流响应的模拟。对热带环流波列及其向南半球的跨赤道传播的动态理解将在新启动的LS4P第二阶段实验中进行深入探讨。
本研究调查了LS4P-I ESMs模拟中全球大气对青藏 Plateau（TP）春季地表温度/地下温度异常的响应机制。为了进一步探索TP的作用及热带环流波列（TRC波列）在短期到季节预测中的影响，我们检查了每个模型在五月的响应。这些结果表明，TRC波列在TP的地表和地下温度对热点区域的影响中发挥了关键作用，特别是在北美地区，尽管TRC波列影响这些不同区域降水的详细机制仍需进一步研究。
我们的目标是将热带低频（TP LST/SUBT）对全球大气环流的影响与热带环流波列（TRC wave train）的动态特征相结合，重点关注其在提高季节到季节（S2S）预测中的重要性。

methodsCn: 在LS4P项目的第一阶段（LS4P-I）中，2003年是重点案例，该年东亚经历了极端的夏季干旱/洪水，春季在青藏 Plateau（TP）则非常寒冷。LS4P-I中进行了两组数值实验，以研究TP春季表面温度异常的全球影响。第一组实验称为EXP_CTRL，旨在评估16个地球系统模型（ESMs）在模拟2003年5月和6月TP气温（T2m）和降水异常方面的表现。在EXP_CTRL实验中，ESMs从4月底或5月1日开始模拟，并使用标准的季节到季节（S2S）预测设置的气候和陆地初始条件。另一组数值实验则由ESMs进行，以测试6月降水的区域偏差是否与5月TP表面温度的偏差相关。在这一组实验中，统称为EXP_LST/SUBT运行，通过初始化TP的陆地表面温度（LST）和土壤温度（SUBT）条件，减少模型在5月TP气温上的偏差。

background: Subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) precipitation prediction in boreal spring and summer months, despite including large number of high-impact events, such as droughts/floods, has remained poor for years. Tibetan Plateau (TP) spring observed surface temperatures show a lag correlation with summer precipitation in several remote regions, but current global land–atmosphere coupled models are unable to represent this behavior due to significant errors in producing observed TP surface temperatures. The land’s role in the climate system at various scales has been the subject of much research since the 1970s. A few land surface attributes, such as albedo, soil moisture, leaf area index, vegetation, and aerosols in snow have been extensively investigated to explore their roles in land–atmosphere interactions. Ocean state is well known to play a major role in modulating Earth’s climate. The linkage of hydrological events to sea surface temperature (SST) anomalies, such as El Niño and La Niña, has been used to predict climate events with useful skill at long lead times ranging from a few months to a few years. However, studies have also consistently shown that the SST only partially explains climate predictability. Recent preliminary studies based on observational data and modeling have indicated that spring land temperature in the Rocky Mountains and the Tibetan Plateau (TP) could affect summer drought/flood in their respective downstream regions with a magnitude comparable to the SST effect and atmospheric internal variability. Although land surface 2-m air temperature (T2m) measurements have the best quality and longest record among various land surface variables with global coverage, their application in land–atmosphere interaction studies, S2S prediction in particular, has largely been overlooked.
research objective: To address these issues, the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program launched the “Impact of Initialized Land Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal-to-Seasonal Prediction” (LS4P) initiative as a community effort to test the impact of land temperature in high-mountain regions on S2S prediction by climate models. This study reveals for the first time that high-mountain land temperature could be a substantial source of S2S precipitation predictability, and its effect is probably as large as ocean surface temperature over global “hotspot” regions identified here. The LS4P objective is to examine whether the observed cold May 2003 TP anomaly causes the observed remote June precipitation anomalies over hotspots worldwide.
challenges: Robust land initialization and model configuration are critical to this effort yet remain scientifically challenging. Most studies of land–atmosphere interactions have been limited by a lack of observational data and tend to focus on local feedbacks. Current state-of-the-art ESMs are unable to fully preserve the memory from initialized LST anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and in the reanalysis data that provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions. There are two issues that need further investigation: 1) The ensemble-mean-produced T2m difference is smaller than the observed anomaly. Would this deficiency cause an underestimation of the TP T2m effect? 2) In some areas, the ensemble mean produces a significant June precipitation difference, such as in western Australia and western Europe, but with the opposite sign compared to the observation. Is this due to a model deficiency in its ability to produce the full TP T2m anomaly and/or correct precipitation anomaly, and/or some other processes involved?
methods: In this study, observed T2m records are used to examine possible relationships between the TP T2m and global precipitation and to identify the locations (hotspots) where the initialization of TP May land temperatures may enhance June precipitation prediction skill. Two pairs of experiments with 16 state-of-the-art LS4P ESMs (Table ES1) have been conducted. In the first experiment (referred to as control run), we evaluate whether the ESMs can properly produce the observed TP T2m anomaly in May 2003 and the June precipitation anomaly. To alleviate the ESMs’ May TP T2m bias and to generate the observed cold TP spring anomaly, we introduce an innovative approach to initializing the LST/SUBT over the TP. After adjusting the LST/SUBT initial conditions based on each model’s T2m bias and observed anomaly over the TP, a second experiment (referred to as the sensitivity run) is conducted using the new LST/SUBT initial condition for each model over the TP, with all other initial and boundary conditions and ensemble members identical to the first experiment.
dataset: In this study, the Chinese Meteorological Administration (CMA) T2m data, which consist in 80 stations over the TP and more than 2,400 stations over all of China, are used over China. The Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS) T2m data are used elsewhere. The Climate Research Unit (CRU) data are used for precipitation over globe.
findings: This study reveals for the first time that high-mountain land temperature could be a substantial source of S2S precipitation predictability, and its effect is probably as large as ocean surface temperature over global “hotspot” regions identified here; the ensemble means in some “hotspots” produce more than 40% of the observed anomalies. Consistent results from observations and multiple ESM experiments show that improving the May TP land temperature simulation through LST/SUBT initialization over the TP allows ESMs to better predict June precipitation over hotspots, and that the LST over high-mountain areas could be a new source of S2S predictability through elevated heating.
backgroundCn: 亚季节到季节（S2S）降水预测在北半球春季和夏季月份中，尽管包括大量高影响事件，如干旱/洪水，但多年来预测效果仍然较差。青藏高原（TP）春季观测到的地表温度与多个远程地区的夏季降水存在滞后相关性，但当前全球陆气耦合模型由于在生成观测到的TP地表温度方面存在显著误差，无法表现出这种行为。自1970年代以来，土地在不同尺度气候系统中的作用一直是许多研究的主题。一些土地表面属性，如反照率、土壤湿度、叶面积指数、植被和雪中的气溶胶，已被广泛研究以探讨它们在陆气相互作用中的作用。海洋状态众所周知在调节地球气候中发挥着重要作用。水文事件与海表温度（SST）异常之间的联系，如厄尔尼诺和拉尼娜，已被用于预测气候事件，并在几个月到几年范围内具有有用的技能。然而，研究也一致表明，SST仅部分解释气候可预测性。基于观测数据和建模的近期初步研究表明，落基山脉和青藏高原的春季地面温度可能影响各自下游地区的夏季干旱/洪水，其影响程度与SST效应和大气内部变率相当。尽管地表2米气温（T2m）测量在各种陆地表面变量中具有最佳质量和最长记录，并且具有全球覆盖，但在陆气相互作用研究中，特别是在S2S预测中的应用仍然被忽视。
research objectiveCn: 为了解决这些问题，全球能源与水交换（GEWEX）计划启动了“初始化的陆地温度和雪盖对亚季节到季节预测的影响”（LS4P）倡议，作为一项社区努力，测试高山地区的陆地温度对气候模型亚季节到季节（S2S）预测的影响。这项研究首次揭示，高山陆地温度可能是S2S降水可预测性的一个重要来源，其影响可能与全球“热点”地区的海洋表面温度相当。LS4P的目标是检验2003年5月观察到的青藏高原冷异常是否导致全球热点地区6月降水异常的出现。
challengesCn: 稳健的土地初始化和模型配置对这一努力至关重要，但仍然具有科学挑战性。大多数关于陆地-大气相互作用的研究受到观测数据不足的限制，往往集中于局部反馈。目前最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）无法完全保留初始化的地表温度（LST）异常的记忆，原因在于模型参数化和提供不平衡初始大气/陆地条件的再分析数据存在缺陷。有两个问题需要进一步研究：1）集合均值产生的2米气温（T2m）差异小于观测异常。这一缺陷是否会导致对热带气候（TP）T2m效应的低估？2）在某些地区，集合均值产生了显著的6月降水差异，例如在西澳大利亚和西欧，但与观测结果的符号相反。这是由于模型在产生完整的TP T2m异常和/或正确的降水异常方面的缺陷，还是涉及其他一些过程？
methodsCn: 在这项研究中，观察到的T2m记录被用来检查TP T2m与全球降水之间可能的关系，并识别出初始化TP 5月地面温度可能增强6月降水预测技能的位置（热点）。进行了两组实验，使用16个最先进的LS4P ESMs（表ES1）。在第一个实验（称为控制运行）中，我们评估ESMs是否能够正确产生2003年5月的TP T2m异常和6月的降水异常。为了减轻ESMs在5月TP T2m上的偏差，并生成观察到的寒冷TP春季异常，我们引入了一种创新的方法来初始化TP的LST/SUBT。在根据每个模型的T2m偏差和TP的观察异常调整LST/SUBT初始条件后，进行了第二个实验（称为敏感性运行），该实验使用新的TP LST/SUBT初始条件，所有其他初始和边界条件以及集合成员与第一个实验相同。
datasetCn: 在本研究中，使用了中国气象局（CMA）的T2m数据，该数据涵盖了青藏高原的80个站点和中国境内超过2400个站点。气候异常监测系统（CAMS）的T2m数据用于其他地区。气候研究单位（CRU）的数据用于全球降水。
findingsCn: 这项研究首次揭示，高山地区的地面温度可能是季节到季节（S2S）降水可预测性的一个重要来源，其影响可能与全球“热点”区域的海洋表面温度相当；在一些“热点”区域，集合均值产生的观测异常超过40%。来自观测和多个地球系统模型（ESM）实验的一致结果表明，通过对青藏 Plateau（TP）地区的地面温度进行LST/SUBT初始化，可以改善5月TP地区的地面温度模拟，从而使ESM更好地预测6月在热点地区的降水，并且高山地区的地面温度可能通过升高的加热成为S2S可预测性的一个新来源。

background: The successful prediction of droughts and floods at subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) time scales is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction, with failures that can result in major adverse impacts on societies and economies. Improving the prediction skill at S2S timescale requires a further understanding of the mechanisms at work for climate variabilities at this timescale as well as the identification of predictability sources. Recent studies suggest that springtime land surface/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) provides a new source of predictability at S2S time scales. The Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program has initiated the project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” to investigate the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions.
research objective: The project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” was initiated to study the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions. The present work explores the simulated global scale response of the atmospheric circulation to the springtime TP land surface cooling by 16 current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) participating in the LS4P Phase I (LS4P-I) experiment.
challenges: The participant models that fail in capturing the TRC wave train greatly under-predict climate anomalies in reference to observations and the successful models. However, the simulated propagation pathways from the TP into the Southern Hemisphere show large inter-model differences.
methods: In the first phase of the LS4P project (LS4P-I), the year 2003 is the focal case, in which extreme summer drought/flood occurred in East Asia after a very cold spring in the TP. Two sets of numerical experiments were conducted in LS4P-I to investigate the global influence of the TP spring surface temperature anomaly. A first set of runs, referred to as EXP_CTRL, is designed to evaluate the performance of the 16 ESMs in simulating the TP T2m and precipitation anomalies during May and June 2003. In EXP_CTRL runs, the ESMs start simulations from late April or May 1st, and use the standard S2S prediction setting of atmospheric and land initial conditions. Another set of numerical experiments was carried out by the ESMs to test whether the regional bias in June precipitation mentioned in the previous paragraph is related to the bias in May surface temperature over TP. In this set of experiments, which are collectively referred to as EXP_LST/SUBT run, the models’ bias in May TP T2m is reduced by initializing the TP LST and SUBT conditions.
dataset: The observed T2m anomaly in the TP is shown in Fig. 1a, for which we use the data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS, Fan and van den Dool 2008). We use the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5, Hersbach et al. 2020), which is referred to as observations, with a regular horizontal resolution of 1.0° × 1.0° to investigate the atmospheric circulation in year 2003 and for climatology, with the latter defined as the average from year 1981 to 2015. The global precipitation data are from the Climate Research Unit (CRU), in which version 4.02 is used when implementing the analysis.
findings: The LS4P-I results show, for the first time, that springtime TP surface anomalies can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal (TRC) wave train from the TP via the northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the western part of the North America, along with the springtime westerly jet from TP across the whole North Pacific basin. These results suggest that the TP LST/SUBT anomaly via the TRC wave train is the first order source of the S2S variability in the regions mentioned. Furthermore, the TP surface temperature anomaly can influence the Southern Hemispheric circulation by generating cross-equator wave trains.

datasetCn: 在图1a中显示了青藏高原（TP）地区的T2m异常，数据来源于美国国家海洋和大气管理局（NOAA）气候异常监测系统（CAMS，Fan和van den Dool 2008）。我们使用第五代欧洲中期天气预报中心大气再分析（ERA5，Hersbach等，2020），该数据被称为观测数据，具有1.0° × 1.0°的规则水平分辨率，以研究2003年的大气环流以及气候学，后者定义为1981年至2015年的平均值。全球降水数据来自气候研究单位（CRU），在实施分析时使用的是4.02版本。
findingsCn: LS4P-I的结果首次表明，春季的温度异常可以通过青藏 Plateau-落基山脉的准纬向波列（TRC）从青藏 Plateau 传播到东北亚和白令海峡，再到北美西部，同时影响整个北太平洋盆地的春季西风急流。这些结果表明，青藏 Plateau 的地表温度/土壤湿度异常通过 TRC 波列是上述地区季节到季节变率的主要来源。此外，青藏 Plateau 的地表温度异常还可以通过产生跨赤道波列影响南半球的环流。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'LS4P-I experiment' mean in the context of data collection techniques for subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在次季节到季节预测的数据收集技术背景下，“LS4P-I实验”是什么意思？
Definition.AnswerEn: The 'LS4P-I experiment' refers to the first phase of the LS4P project, which investigates the global influence of the Tibetan Plateau's spring surface temperature anomalies on subseasonal-to-seasonal predictions. It involves conducting numerical experiments to evaluate and improve model predictions of temperature and precipitation anomalies using Earth System Models (ESMs).
Definition.AnswerCn: 'LS4P-I实验'指的是LS4P项目的第一阶段，该项目研究青藏 Plateau春季表面温度异常对亚季节到季节预测的全球影响。它涉及进行数值实验，以评估和改进使用地球系统模型（ESMs）对温度和降水异常的预测。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods for land surface temperature and snowpack initialization in the LS4P project compare to traditional atmospheric reanalysis techniques?
Comparison.QuestionCn: LS4P项目中土地表面温度和雪盖初始化的数据收集方法与传统的大气再分析技术相比如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The LS4P project employs innovative methods for initializing land surface temperature and snowpack, specifically focusing on reducing biases in May TP T2m by adjusting initial conditions, whereas traditional atmospheric reanalysis techniques, such as those used by ECMWF's ERA5, rely on historical data assimilation without specific focus on regional biases. This tailored initialization approach in LS4P aims to enhance prediction skill for S2S variability by accurately simulating high-mountain land temperature impacts.
Comparison.AnswerCn: LS4P项目采用创新方法初始化地表温度和雪盖，特别关注通过调整初始条件来减少5月TP T2m的偏差，而传统的大气重分析技术，如ECMWF的ERA5，依赖于历史数据同化，未特别关注区域偏差。LS4P中的这种定制初始化方法旨在通过准确模拟高山土地温度的影响来增强对S2S变率的预测能力。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in the challenges faced by the LS4P project's Earth System Models (ESMs) when predicting precipitation anomalies compared to those encountered in global atmospheric circulation models?
Comparison.QuestionCn: LS4P项目的地球系统模型（ESMs）在预测降水异常时面临的挑战与全球大气环流模型所遇到的挑战有什么不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The LS4P project's ESMs face challenges in fully capturing the TRC wave train and its propagation, which affects their ability to predict precipitation anomalies accurately. These challenges include inter-model variability and deficiencies in model parameterizations. In contrast, global atmospheric circulation models often struggle with maintaining balanced initial atmospheric/land conditions and preserving memory from initialized LST anomalies, which can lead to discrepancies in long-term precipitation predictability.
Comparison.AnswerCn: LS4P项目的ESM面临着无法完全捕捉TRC波列及其传播的挑战，这影响了它们准确预测降水异常的能力。这些挑战包括模型间的变异性和模型参数化的缺陷。相比之下，全球大气环流模型通常在维持平衡的初始大气/陆地条件和保持从初始化的LST异常中获得的记忆方面存在困难，这可能导致长期降水可预测性上的差异。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise in ensuring the accuracy and consistency of data when initializing land surface temperature and subsurface temperature for simulations in high-mountain regions like the Tibetan Plateau?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在高山地区如青藏高原初始化地表温度和地下温度进行模拟时，确保数据的准确性和一致性可能会面临哪些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Challenges include the large inter-model differences in simulated propagation pathways, phase differences between simulated wave trains and observations, and potential warm biases in model simulations compared to observed anomalies. These issues can affect the model's ability to accurately predict atmospheric responses and may stem from deficiencies in model parameterizations and unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 挑战包括模拟传播路径的模型间差异较大、模拟波列与观测之间的相位差异，以及模型模拟与观测异常相比可能存在的温暖偏差。这些问题可能影响模型准确预测大气响应的能力，并可能源于模型参数化的缺陷和不平衡的初始大气/陆地条件。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What methodological strategies might improve the capture of remote atmospheric circulation changes in Earth System Models when simulating the influence of land surface temperature anomalies?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 哪些方法论策略可能改善地球系统模型在模拟陆地表面温度异常影响时捕捉远程大气环流变化的能力？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Improving the capture of these changes may involve enhancing the initialization techniques for land surface temperature and subsurface temperature, reducing biases in model simulations through better parameterizations, and utilizing high-resolution observational datasets to refine initial conditions. Enhanced model resolution and improved land-atmosphere interaction representations may also help address inter-model variability and better capture the teleconnections like those modulated by the TRC wave train.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 改善对这些变化的捕捉可能涉及增强地表温度和地下温度的初始化技术，通过更好的参数化减少模型模拟中的偏差，以及利用高分辨率观测数据集来优化初始条件。提高模型分辨率和改进陆地-大气相互作用的表现也可能有助于解决模型间的变异性，更好地捕捉由TRC波列调制的遥相关现象。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the difficulty in accurately predicting subseasonal-to-seasonal climate events using land surface temperature data from high mountain regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 哪些因素导致使用高山地区的地表温度数据准确预测季节内到季节气候事件的困难？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The challenges in accurately predicting subseasonal-to-seasonal climate events using land surface temperature data from high mountain regions arise primarily from the deficiencies in model parameterizations, unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions from reanalysis data, and significant errors in representing observed land surface temperatures. Additionally, the inability of current models to fully preserve the memory of initialized land surface temperature anomalies and the lack of robust land initialization contribute to these difficulties.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 使用高山地区的地表温度数据准确预测季节内到季节气候事件的挑战主要源于模型参数化的缺陷、再分析数据中初始大气/陆地条件的不平衡，以及在表示观测到的地表温度方面的显著误差。此外，当前模型无法充分保留初始化的地表温度异常的记忆，以及缺乏稳健的陆地初始化也加剧了这些困难。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does the choice of observational datasets influence the outcomes of studies exploring the impact of Tibetan Plateau surface anomalies on global atmospheric circulations?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 观测数据集的选择如何影响研究西藏高原表面异常对全球大气环流影响的结果？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The choice of observational datasets, such as the NOAA Climate Anomaly Monitoring System and ERA5 reanalysis data, plays a critical role in evaluating atmospheric circulation responses to Tibetan Plateau surface anomalies. These datasets provide necessary climatological information but may also contribute to discrepancies in model outputs if biases or limitations in data resolution exist.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 观测数据集的选择，如NOAA气候异常监测系统和ERA5再分析数据，在评估青藏高原表面异常对大气环流响应时起着关键作用。这些数据集提供了必要的气候信息，但如果存在偏差或数据分辨率的限制，也可能导致模型输出之间的差异。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the objectives behind utilizing state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) in the LS4P-I experiment for investigating land surface temperature anomalies?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在LS4P-I实验中利用最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）研究地表温度异常的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objective is to explore the simulated global scale response of atmospheric circulation to springtime Tibetan Plateau land surface cooling by using 16 current state-of-the-art Earth System Models. This is part of the LS4P-I experiment which aims to understand the impact of springtime land surface temperature anomalies on summertime precipitation predictions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是通过使用16个当前最先进的地球系统模型，探讨春季青藏 Plateau 地表降温对大气环流的全球尺度响应。这是 LS4P-I 实验的一部分，旨在理解春季地表温度异常对夏季降水预测的影响。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to examine the relationship between Tibetan Plateau land surface temperature anomalies and global precipitation patterns?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 研究青藏高原地表温度异常与全球降水模式之间的关系是重要的原因是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: It is important because recent studies suggest that springtime land surface temperature anomalies over the Tibetan Plateau can be a substantial source of subseasonal-to-seasonal precipitation predictability. Understanding this relationship can enhance the skill of climate models in predicting high-impact events like droughts and floods in remote regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 这很重要，因为最近的研究表明，春季青藏 Plateau 的地表温度异常可能是亚季节到季节降水可预测性的一个重要来源。理解这种关系可以提高气候模型在预测偏远地区高影响事件（如干旱和洪水）方面的能力。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the primary methods used to initialize land surface temperature and subsurface temperature conditions in high-mountain regions for subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction models?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在高山地区的亚季节到季节预测模型中，初始化地表温度和地下温度条件的主要方法有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The initialization of land surface temperature and subsurface temperature conditions in high-mountain regions, such as the Tibetan Plateau, involves reducing biases by adjusting initial conditions based on each model's temperature bias and observed anomalies. This is done to enhance the prediction skill of Earth System Models for subseasonal-to-seasonal time scales.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 高山地区（如青藏 Plateau）的地表温度和地下温度条件的初始化涉及通过根据每个模型的温度偏差和观测异常调整初始条件来减少偏差。这是为了提高地球系统模型在亚季节到季节时间尺度上的预测能力。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What challenges are encountered in preserving memory from initialized land surface temperature anomalies within Earth System Models, and how are these addressed procedurally?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在地球系统模型中，保存初始化的地表温度异常的记忆面临哪些挑战，以及这些挑战是如何在程序上得到解决的？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Challenges include deficiencies in model parameterizations and unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions from reanalysis data. These are addressed by introducing innovative approaches for initializing land surface and subsurface temperature conditions, allowing models to better simulate temperature anomalies and enhance prediction accuracy.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 挑战包括模型参数化的不足以及来自再分析数据的不平衡初始大气/陆地条件。通过引入创新的方法来初始化陆地表面和地下温度条件，从而解决这些问题，使模型能够更好地模拟温度异常并提高预测准确性。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What experimental setups or simulation protocols enable the accurate initialization of land surface temperature and subsurface temperature for LS4P-I experiments?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些实验设置或模拟协议能够准确初始化LS4P-I实验中的地表温度和地下温度？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Two sets of numerical experiments were conducted in LS4P-I to investigate the influence of TP spring surface temperature anomaly. The first set evaluates the performance of the ESMs in simulating TP T2m and precipitation anomalies, while the second set reduces biases by initializing LST/SUBT conditions.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在LS4P-I中进行了两组数值实验，以研究TP春季表面温度异常的影响。第一组评估了ESMs在模拟TP T2m和降水异常方面的表现，而第二组通过初始化LST/SUBT条件来减少偏差。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do advancements in reanalysis data contribute to addressing challenges in preserving the memory of initialized land surface temperature anomalies in Earth System Models?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 再分析数据的进展如何有助于应对在地球系统模型中保持初始化的地表温度异常记忆的挑战？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Current state-of-the-art ESMs struggle to preserve the memory of initialized LST anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and reanalysis data that provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions. Robust land initialization and model configuration remain scientifically challenging.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 当前最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）在保持初始化的陆地表面温度（LST）异常的记忆方面存在困难，这主要是由于模型参数化和再分析数据的缺陷，导致初始大气/陆地条件不平衡。稳健的陆地初始化和模型配置仍然是科学上具有挑战性的任务。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What role does the integration of multiple observational datasets play in enhancing the prediction skill of subseasonal-to-seasonal precipitation in high-mountain regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 多种观测数据集的整合在提高高山地区亚季节到季节降水预测技能方面发挥了什么作用？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Observed T2m records, such as those from CMA and CAMS, are used to examine relationships between TP T2m and global precipitation. This helps identify hotspots where initialization of TP land temperatures may enhance prediction skill, supported by multiple ESM experiments showing improved predictions with better initialization.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 观测到的T2m记录，如来自CMA和CAMS的数据，用于研究TP T2m与全球降水之间的关系。这有助于识别TP地表温度初始化可能增强预测技能的热点，多个ESM实验表明，通过更好的初始化可以改善预测。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be significant challenges in accurately simulating the Tibetan Plateau's spring land surface temperature anomalies using Earth System Models?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么在使用地球系统模型准确模拟青藏高原春季地表温度异常时可能会面临重大挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: There are challenges due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and in the reanalysis data that provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions. The ensemble-mean-produced temperature difference is smaller than the observed anomaly, and in some areas, the models produce precipitation differences with the opposite sign compared to observations.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 由于模型参数化和提供不平衡初始大气/陆地条件的再分析数据存在缺陷，因此面临挑战。集合均值产生的温度差异小于观察到的异常，在某些地区，模型产生的降水差异与观察结果的符号相反。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the expectations for improving subseasonal-to-seasonal precipitation prediction using high-mountain land temperature data?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 利用高山地表温度数据改善亚季节到季节降水预测的期望是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The expectation is that high-mountain land temperature could be a substantial source of subseasonal-to-seasonal precipitation predictability, potentially as influential as ocean surface temperatures. Initializing land surface and subsurface temperatures in models allows better prediction of precipitation over identified hotspot regions.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 预计高山地区的地面温度可能成为亚季节到季节降水可预测性的一个重要来源，其影响力可能与海洋表面温度相当。通过在模型中初始化地表和地下温度，可以更好地预测在已识别的热点区域的降水。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might current global land–atmosphere coupled models struggle with representing the correlation between spring Tibetan Plateau temperatures and summer precipitation in remote regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 当前全球陆气耦合模型可能在表示春季青藏 Plateau 温度与远程地区夏季降水之间的相关性方面存在困难，原因可能是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Current models struggle due to significant errors in simulating observed Tibetan Plateau surface temperatures, and the difficulty in preserving memory from initialized land surface temperature anomalies. Robust land initialization remains scientifically challenging, and models often have deficiencies that prevent accurate representation of these interactions.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 当前模型在模拟观察到的青藏 Plateau 表面温度方面存在显著误差，并且在保持初始化的地表温度异常的记忆方面也面临困难。稳健的土地初始化仍然是科学上的挑战，模型通常存在缺陷，无法准确表示这些相互作用。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the potential challenges in collecting reliable land surface temperature and subsurface temperature data for subseasonal to seasonal prediction models?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在收集可靠的地表温度和地下温度数据以用于次季节到季节预测模型时，可能面临哪些挑战？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Robust land initialization and model configuration are critical challenges yet remain scientifically demanding. The current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) often struggle to preserve the memory from initialized land surface temperature anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and in reanalysis data that provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 稳健的土地初始化和模型配置是关键挑战，但仍然具有科学上的难度。目前最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）往往难以保持初始化的陆地表面温度异常的记忆，这主要是由于模型参数化和提供不平衡初始大气/陆地条件的再分析数据的缺陷。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How might data collection techniques need to evolve to better capture the influence of high-mountain land temperatures on global atmospheric circulation?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 数据收集技术可能需要如何演变，以更好地捕捉高山土地温度对全球大气环流的影响？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Data collection techniques might need to evolve to incorporate better initialization methods for land surface temperature and subsurface temperature in high-mountain regions. This could involve using innovative approaches to adjust initial conditions based on observed anomalies and model biases to improve the prediction of atmospheric responses and precipitation over identified hotspot regions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 数据收集技术可能需要发展，以更好地初始化高山地区的地表温度和地下温度。这可能涉及使用创新的方法，根据观测到的异常和模型偏差调整初始条件，以改善对识别出的热点地区大气响应和降水的预测。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What improvements in datasets could enhance the accuracy of atmospheric circulation simulations in Earth System Models?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 哪些数据集的改进可以提高地球系统模型中大气环流模拟的准确性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Improvements in datasets could include enhanced spatial resolution and more accurate land surface temperature measurements. Using high-resolution reanalysis data and integrating comprehensive observational data from various global monitoring systems, such as the Chinese Meteorological Administration and Climate Research Unit, may enhance the accuracy of simulations and better capture the effects of land temperature anomalies on atmospheric circulation.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 数据集的改进可以包括提高空间分辨率和更准确的地表温度测量。利用高分辨率的再分析数据，并整合来自各种全球监测系统的全面观测数据，如中国气象局和气候研究单位，可能会提高模拟的准确性，更好地捕捉地温异常对大气环流的影响。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about how data on land surface temperature and snowpack is typically collected in high mountain regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定高山地区的地表温度和雪层数据通常是如何收集的。
Assertion.AnswerEn: In the LS4P project, observed T2m records are used to examine relationships between the Tibetan Plateau's (TP) land surface temperature and global precipitation. Data from the Chinese Meteorological Administration (CMA), consisting of numerous stations over China, and the Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS) are utilized to capture temperature anomalies. The Climate Research Unit (CRU) data provides global precipitation information.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在LS4P项目中，观察到的T2m记录用于研究青藏高原（TP）地表温度与全球降水之间的关系。使用中国气象局（CMA）提供的数据，包括中国多个气象站的数据，以及气候异常监测系统（CAMS）来捕捉温度异常。气候研究单位（CRU）数据提供全球降水信息。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how the models are initialized with land surface temperature and snowpack conditions for simulations.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解模型是如何用地表温度和雪层条件初始化进行模拟的。
Assertion.AnswerEn: In the LS4P-I experiment, numerical experiments are conducted where models are initialized with the land surface temperature (LST) and subsurface temperature (SUBT) conditions of the Tibetan Plateau, with the aim of reducing biases in May TP temperatures. Initial conditions are adjusted based on each model's T2m bias and observed anomalies to better simulate the global influence of TP spring surface temperature anomalies.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在LS4P-I实验中，进行数值实验，模型以青藏高原的地表温度（LST）和地下温度（SUBT）条件为初始化，旨在减少5月青藏高原温度的偏差。初始条件根据每个模型的2米气温（T2m）偏差和观测异常进行调整，以更好地模拟青藏高原春季表面温度异常对全球的影响。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify and describe the potential sources for datasets that could enhance the understanding of land surface temperature's impact on atmospheric circulations in subseasonal-to-seasonal predictions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别和描述可能的数据集来源，这些数据集可以增强对地表温度对亚季节到季节预测中大气环流影响的理解。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets include the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS) for T2m data, the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5) for atmospheric circulation analysis, and the Climate Research Unit (CRU) data for global precipitation. These datasets provide comprehensive observational data necessary for investigating the impact of land surface temperature anomalies.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 潜在的数据集包括国家海洋和大气管理局（NOAA）气候异常监测系统（CAMS）的T2m数据，第五代欧洲中期天气预报中心（ECMWF）大气重分析（ERA5）用于大气环流分析，以及气候研究单位（CRU）全球降水数据。这些数据集提供了全面的观测数据，必要用于研究地表温度异常的影响。
